page.title: 01MARK MOOR - NORTH
page.content: FLAT SOMERSET MOORLAND, THERE IS LITTLE TO BREAK UP THIS LOW LYING COUNTRYSIDE. TO THE WEST, BRENT KNOLL ACTS AS A WIND BREAK WHEN SALT LADEN AIR COMES IN OFF THE BRISTOL CHANNEL. THE MENDIPS, SOME 4 KM TO THE NORTH OFFER SOME PROTECTION IN WINTER. TO THE SOUTH, MOORLAND STRETCHES AWAY INTO THE DISTANCE. THIS MOORLAND IS WELL DRAINED BY A SYSTEM OF RHINES AND DITCHES. AS A RESULT HEAVY CROPS OF HAY IS BEING CUT THIS SUMMER FOR WINTER FEED. LINKED TO THE FARMING COMMUNITY IS THE MILK PROCESSING DAIRY AT ROOKSBRIDGE UNTIL RECENTLY SURPLUS MILK WAS CONVERTED INTO CHEDDAR CHEESE.NOW ,MILK AND CREAM ARE ITS PRODUCTS. THE A38 PASSES THROUGH THE NORTH WEST SECTION.ALONGSIDE THIS, AT TARNOCK, THERE IS A LARGE AREA OF GLASS FOR TOMATOES AND STRAWBERRIES.
